info.name: ahuri-cli
info.summary: Use Ahuri from the command line!

info.author: sqdnoises
info.description:
# ahuri-cli v1.0.1 ![Python language](https://img.shields.io/badge/language-Python_3-blue) ![PyPI](https://img.shields.io/badge/PyPI.org-ahuri--cli-orange) ![MIT license](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-brightgreen)
Use Ahuri from the command line!
This repository contains the source code for `ahuri-cli`.
View the [PyPI repository](https://pypi.org/project/ahuri-cli) for this CLI app. **NOTE:** THIS APP CURRENTLY DOES **NOT** WORK ON SYSTEMS RUNNING WINDOWS. --- # How to use this app? ## Requirements You need [Python 3.8+](https://python.org) with pip on path. ## Installation Open a terminal and type: ```py $ pip install ahuri-cli ``` ## Usage You can use the command `ahuri` to use the app.
Use `ahuri -h` to view the main help page.
